result.execSummary:
The defendant Shewonnia L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Concurrent with: Cases 15CM1639 & 15CM0706

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
**FIRST 60  DAYS of Probation to be with SCRAM Monitoring.
**11/12/2015 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FROM DOC FOR DEFENDANT TO BE MONITORED BY THE SOBERLINK DEVICE INSTEAD OF SCRAM.**

Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendations. Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.   Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #2:  60 Days Huber, huber with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody) - Consecutive to Count #3  &  Concurrent with Case #15CM706  & Consecutive to Case #15CM1369 (07/05/16-JC, Correct Case Number is 15CM1639).

COUNT #3: 60 Days Huber, huber with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody) - Consecutive to Count #2  &  Concurrent with Case #15CM706  & Consecutive to Case #15CM1369 (07/05/16-JC, Correct Case Number is 15CM1639).


**Any financial obligations owed are converted to a civil judgment**
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

(Orig.) ... for amendment to the Judgment of Conviction, dated 10/29/15, filed by Agent Jumbeck.

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS (62 Days credit, if revoked)  *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #3 AND CASE #15CM1639 AND CASE #15CM706

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia  
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management and follow through as recommended by agent 
____1st 60 Days of probation to be with SCRAM monitoring 

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #3:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS (62 Days credit, if revoked)  *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #2 AND CASE #15CM1639 AND CASE #15CM706

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia  
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management and follow through as recommended by agent 
____1st 60 Days of probation to be with SCRAM monitoring 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Sentencing hearing on September 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.    Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant allowed one visit back to her residence, with law enforcement present, to obtain her personal property.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #2 & 3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #2 & 3.  Counts #1 and 4 are dismissed and read-in.  Court modifies bail to signature bond with some added conditions.  Court sets sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
